Compare {{cog|nl|-}}, {{cog|fy|-}}, and {{cog|en|man}}, {{cog|da|mand}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[man]}} * {{audio|de|De-Mann.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|an}} * {{homophones|de|man}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Mannes|gen2=Manns|M√§nner|pl2=Mann|pl3=Mannen|M√§nnchen|dim2=M√§nnlein|f=M√§nnin}} # [[man]], [[male]] [[human being]] #* '''2007''', Anton Schiefner, edited by Hartmut Walravens, ''√úbersetzungen aus dem tibetischen Kanhjur. Beitr√§ge zur Buddhismuskunde und zur zentralasiatischen M√§rchenforschung'', Harrasowitz Verlag, Wiesbaden, p. 25 and 29: #*: Da er ihn nicht in der Sonne aber auch nicht im Schatten bringen lassen sollte, befahl er dem '''Manne''', den Topf an die Spitze eines Stockes zu binden und mit einem d√ºnnen Gewande zu bedecken. #*: Dem '''Manne''' aber sagte er: [...] # [[husband]] ====Usage notes==== * The normal plural is '''''M√§nner''''', which can be used in all contexts and is now used exclusively in contexts other than the following. * The unchanged plural ''Mann'' is sometimes used after numerals. It means "men" as a measure for size or strength of a group rather than individuals: ''Mit drei Mann k√∂nnen wir den Schrank heben'' ‚Äì "With three people we can lift the cupboard." Military or police personnel, team members, demonstrators and the like are often counted using this unchanged plural. This may actually include women. * The plural ''Mannen'' is now rare and somewhat poetic. It usually means a group of men, often soldiers, under the command or leadership of somebody: ''C√§sars Mannen'' ("Caesar's men"). It is sometimes heard in sports jargon: ''die Mannen von Trainer XY'' ("coach XY's men"). ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|pl=M√§nner}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|husband}} {{l|de|Ehemann}}, {{l|de|Gemahl}} ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|man (male), by gender}} {{l|de|Frau}} {{g|f}}, {{l|de|M√§nnin}} {{g|f}} * {{sense|man (male), by age}} {{l|de|Junge}} {{g|m}}, {{l|de|Knabe}} {{g|m}}, {{l|de|Bub}} {{g|m}}, {{l|de|Bube}} {{g|m}} {{q|chiefly Swiss and Austrian}} * {{sense|husband}} {{l|de|Frau}} {{g|f}}, {{l|de|Ehefrau}} {{g|f}} ====Hypernyms==== * {{sense|man (male)}} {{l|de|Mensch}} * {{sense|husband}} {{l|de|Ehepartner}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de |bemannt |Bergmann |Bl√∂dmann |Buhmann |Ehemann |Englischmann |F√§hrmann |FBI-Mann |Feuerwehrmann |Franzmann |Froschmann |Gefolgsmann |Gesch√§ftsmann |Hampelmann |Hauptmann |Kaufmann |Landmann |Lebemann |mannbar |M√§nnchen |M√§nnergesellschaft |M√§nnerkleid |M√§nnerkleider |Manneskraft |Mannestum |mannhaft |Mannheit |m√§nnlich |[[Manns genug sein]], [[Mannes genug sein]] |Mannschaft |Mannst√§rke |mannstoll |Mannzahl |Mustermann |Neumann |Putzmann |Sandmann |Schneemann |Schutzmann |Seemann |Wassermann |Weidmann }} ====Related terms==== {{rel4|de |M√§nneken |M√§nnin |m√§nniglich |Mensch }} ---- ==German Low German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nds-de|osx|man}}, from {{inh|nds-de|gem-pro|*mann-}}, from {{inh|nds-de|ine-pro|*mon-}}.
